snippet: An agreement with Mr. Garner’s family, to resolve the claim over his killing by the police on Staten Island, appeared among the biggest so far as part of a city strategy to settle major civil rights claims even before a lawsuit is filed.
abstract: New York City settles with family of Eric Garner, paying $5.9 million to satisfy wrongful-death claim over his killing by police on Staten Island in July 2014; Garner's death sparked national debate about police behavior in minority communities and racial discrimination in criminal justice system.
lead_paragraph: An agreement with Mr. Garner’s family, to resolve the claim over his killing by the police on Staten Island, appeared among the biggest so far as part of a city strategy to settle major civil rights claims even before a lawsuit is filed.

headline.main: Eric Garner Case Is Settled by New York City for $5.9 Million
headline.print_headline: City Settlement of $5.9 Million in Garner Case
